rubrics.rubric: Pain in gallbladder region (right hypochondrium), colicky in nature
rubrics.modality: Worse pressure, motion; better bending forward

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone colic radiating to right scapula or clavicle
rubrics.modality: Pain travels from liver area to shoulder blade

rubrics.rubric: Gallbladder pain with vomiting of bile and bitter taste
rubrics.modality: Nausea and vomiting after fatty food

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone pain worse after rich, fatty or fried food
rubrics.modality: Fats aggravate gallbladder spasm
rubrics.notes: One of the most clinically confirmatory modalities

rubrics.rubric: Gallbladder pain with yellowish skin or eyes (sub-jaundice)
rubrics.modality: Obstructive type jaundice

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone pain worse at night, especially after 2 AM
rubrics.modality: Paroxysmal pain pattern at hepatic time

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone attack with chilliness and cannot bear to move
rubrics.modality: Severe pain > absolute rest

rubrics.rubric: Gallbladder pain with irritability and anger
rubrics.modality: Biliary irritation shows on mental plane

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone colic alternating with gastric acidity or ulcers
rubrics.modality: One suppresses other in periodic cycle

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone pain with distension and belching
rubrics.modality: Better warm drinks or passing flatus

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone attacks < during suppressed anger or emotional suppression
rubrics.modality: Triggered after insult or unexpressed emotions
rubrics.notes: Mind-body link: bile congestion after mental stress

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone pain alternating with skin eruptions
rubrics.modality: Skin clears up → gallstone flare begins

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone pain alternating with piles
rubrics.modality: Worse when piles suppressed or disappear

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone symptoms < menses or ovulation period
rubrics.modality: Hormonal gallbladder sensitivity

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone colic with stitching pain under right ribs
rubrics.modality: Stitching pains < motion, > pressure

rubrics.rubric: Gallbladder pain > warm drinks, < cold water
rubrics.modality: Thermal modality important in remedy choice

rubrics.rubric: Gallstones with excessive craving for sour food or pickles
rubrics.modality: Sour craving indicates liver-biliary overload

rubrics.rubric: Gallbladder pain > lying on abdomen, < lying on back
rubrics.modality: Pressure helps in gallbladder congestion

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone pain in patients with diabetes or metabolic syndrome
rubrics.modality: Fat metabolism failure leading to biliary disease
rubrics.notes: Constitutional overlap important for remedy selection

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone colic with great anxiety and restlessness
rubrics.modality: Mental state during acute biliary crisis

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone tendency after suppression of skin eruptions or acne
rubrics.modality: H/O long suppression with ointments or steroids
rubrics.notes: Important in young adults & constitutional layers

rubrics.rubric: Gallbladder congestion after long-standing grief or shock
rubrics.modality: Silent suffering personality profile

rubrics.rubric: Gallstones with monthly colic before or during menses
rubrics.modality: Colic overlaps with hormonal changes
rubrics.notes: Useful in cyclical biliary pains in women

rubrics.rubric: Gallstones with history of long-term oral contraceptive use
rubrics.modality: Hormonal suppression weakens bile flow

rubrics.rubric: Gallbladder pain alternates with constipation
rubrics.modality: Gall colic when bowels inactive

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone formation in fat, flabby, chilly constitution
rubrics.modality: Chilly, sluggish digestion, intolerance to exertion
rubrics.notes: Important general type in sluggish gallbladder

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone tendency in hot, thin, restless, anxious persons
rubrics.modality: Warm-blooded, oversensitive to touch and noise
rubrics.notes: Contrasts the Calc carb type — used for differentiation

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone pain triggered by fright, bad news, or exam fear
rubrics.modality: Sympathetic overdrive leads to hepatic spasm
rubrics.notes: Gallbladder as organ of shock reaction

rubrics.rubric: Gallstones alternating with vertigo and headache
rubrics.modality: When gall improves, vertigo appears (and vice versa)

rubrics.rubric: Gallbladder pain with depression, indifference, aversion to loved ones
rubrics.modality: Silent emotional disconnection precedes attack
rubrics.notes: Mind–body correlation useful for remedy match

rubrics.rubric: Gallstones in obese patients with sluggish liver function
rubrics.modality: Obesity with intolerance to rich food
rubrics.notes: Sycosis-induced bile stasis from metabolic overload

rubrics.rubric: Gallstones in diabetic patients with dyspepsia
rubrics.modality: Diabetes with burping, bitter taste, early fullness

rubrics.rubric: Gallstones coexisting with fatty liver disease (NAFLD)
rubrics.modality: Hepatic congestion, poor bile drainage
rubrics.notes: Fatty degeneration linked to stone formation

rubrics.rubric: Gallstones with polycystic ovaries (PCOD) or hormonal syndromes
rubrics.modality: Female with irregular menses, fat intolerance, acne

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone formation in sedentary, constipated individuals
rubrics.modality: Low motility, bowel stasis → bile thickening
rubrics.notes: Functional stasis leading to sludge & stones

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone attacks after alcohol consumption
rubrics.modality: Worse next morning or at night

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone complaints in post-COVID or post-viral states
rubrics.modality: After viral hepatitis, dengue, or COVID-19

rubrics.rubric: Gallstones with disturbed circadian rhythm and sleep issues
rubrics.modality: Night duty, irregular eating, 2–3 AM aggravation

rubrics.rubric: Gallstones with chronic acidity and reflux
rubrics.modality: Stone attacks precede or follow acidity bouts

rubrics.rubric: Gallstone tendency in hypothyroid patients
rubrics.modality: Obese, sluggish, constipated, with hair fall
